alert.note: Alert for Brazoria; Fort Bend (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 7:41PM CST until January 31 at 12:46AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Brazos River near Rosharon affecting Fort Bend and Brazoria Counties. For the Brazos River...including Bryan, West Columbia, US 59, Sugar Land, TX, Hempstead, Bellville, San Felipe, Richmond, Rosharon... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Brazos River near Rosharon. * WHEN...From this evening to early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 46.5 feet, Minor lowland flooding continues. Livestock should be removed from low areas in the flood plain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Friday the stage was 42.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 42.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 45.0 feet Sunday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 43.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 45.2 feet on 03/15/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (9 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Brazos River Rosharon 43.0 42.8 Fri 7 pm CST 44.4 45.0 44.4 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at 145 PM CST.
